parameters.name: datum_ids
parameters.description:
The list of ids of datums to retrieve. If empty, all datums that the user
has access to will be retrieved.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the datum to delete.

granter_id.description: The id of the user who granted or revoked a permission.

permission.description: The permission that was granted or revoked.

is_grant.description: If true, this grant was a grant. Otherwise, it was a revoke.

AccessMetadataPermissionGrantMetadata.description: Metadata associated with a change in access permissions.

user_id.description: The id of the user whom this access object is associated with.

data_key.description:
The key used to encrypt the actual data, encrypted using this user's
public key and decrypted with their private key.

permissions.description: The list of permissions this user has on this datum.

DatumAccess.description:
An object representing relevant data to a user who has access to this
datum.

owner.description: The user who created and owns this datum.

created_time.description: The time at which this datum was created.

last_edited.description: The time at which this datum was last modified.

access_metadata.description:
A map of id of users with access or who once had access to metadata
associated with that access.

DatumMetadata.description: The metadata associated with this datum.

verification_token.description: The token used to identify the user through the verification process.

options.description: The options available for two-factor authentication.

LoginUserResponseTwoFactorInfo.description:
Represents the relevant information for the two-factor authentication
process to continue.

grant_metadata.description: The grants and revokes that have been given to the user.

MetadataAccessMetadata.description:
Metadata associated with a user who had access to this datum at some
point.

TwoFactorTwoFactorType.description:
An enumeration of type of two-factor authentication.

 - PHONE_TEXT: A code via text message.
 - PHONE_CALL: A code via phone call.
 - EMAIL: A code via email.

apiAEncryptionAlgorithm.description:
An enumeration of different asymmetric encryption algorithms.

 - RSA: Encrypt using AES with a given key.

password.description: The hashed password of the user.

salt.description: The salt used in the new hashed password.

password_hash_algorithm.description: The hashing algorithm used to hash the user's password.

private_key.description: The user's private key, encrypted using the user's password.

data_encryption_algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the user's data.

private_key_encryption_algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the user's private key.

access_token.description: The access token to identify and authenticate the user.

data.description:
The actual data of the datum, such as a password or code, encrypted.
This should decrypt to a string of a json object.

data_key.description:
The key used to encrypt the actual data, encrypted using the owner's
public key and decrypted with their private key.

data_encryption_algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the actual data.

title.description: The title of this datum, given by the user.

data.description:
The actual data of this datum, such as a password or code, encrypted.
This should decrypt to a string of a json object.

data_key.description:
The key used to encrypt the actual data, encrypted using the owner's
public key and decrypted with their private key.

data_encryption_algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the actual data.

accessors.description:
A map of ids of users who have access to this datum to information on what
permissions they have.

metadata.description: The metadata associated with this datum.

datum.description: The deleted datum, as it was before deletion.

datums.description: The datums requested by the user.

user.description: The information of the specified user.

apiHashAlgorithm.description:
An enumeration of different password hashing algorithms.

 - SHA_512: Concatenate password + salt and use SHA-512.

apiJWT.description: A representation of a JSON Web Token.

password.description: The hashed password of the user.

two_factor.description:
The two-factor authentication information if two-factor authentication
is enabled.

response.description:
The user's authentication and information if two-factor authentication
is disabled.

apiPermission.description:
A permission that a user can have on a datum.

 - READ: Permission to read the datum.
 - WRITE: Permission to write the datum.
 - DELETE: Permission to delete the datum.
 - SHARE: Permission to share the datum with other users. The user has the power
to share the same permissions that they have.

private_key.description: The user's private key, encrypted with the user's password.

private_key_encryption_algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the private key.

apiPrivateUser.description: Private information about a user that is only visible to the user.

salt.description: The salt used to hash the user's password.

password_hash_algorithm.description: The hashing algorithm used to hash the user's password.

data_encryption_algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the user's data.

apiPublicUser.description: The public information about a user that is visible to anyone.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token to identify and authenticate the user.

access_token.description: The access token to identify and authenticate the user.

apiSEncryptionAlgorithm.description:
An enumeration of different symmetric encryption algorithms.

 - AES: Encrypt using AES with a given key.

verification_token.description: The token used to identify the user through the verification process.

success.description: Whether or not sending the verification code was successful.

access_token.description: The access token to identify and authenticate the user.

id.description: The id of the datum to share.

target_id.description: The id of the user the datum should be shared with.

data.description:
The actual data of the datum, such as a password or code, encrypted with
the target user's public key.

permissions.description:
The permissions to be granted to this user. These are in addition to any
permissions the user already has.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token to identify and authenticate the user.

access_token.description: The access token to identify and authenticate the user.

id.description: The identifier of this two-factor authentication method.

destination.description: Where the two-factor authentication code is sent (phone, email, etc.).

apiTwoFactor.description: A way to send/receive a two-factor authentication code.

access_token.description: The access token to identify and authenticate the user.

id.description: The id of the datum to update.

data.title:
The new actual data of the datum, such as a password or code, encrypted.
This should decrypt to a string of a json object. (Optional)

access_token.description: The access token to identify and authenticate the user.

old_password.description: The old hashed password of the user.

new_password.description: The new hashed password of the user.

new_salt.description: The salt used in the new hashed password.

new_password_hash_algorithm.description: The hashing algorithm used to hash the user's new password.

private_key.description: The user's private key, re-encrypted with the user's new password.

private_key_encryption_algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the user's private key.

apiUser.description: The public and private information about a user.

verification_token.description: The token used to identify the user through the verification process.

code.description: The two-factor authentication code received on the specified destination.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.
